title: Back Endsheets
html: Back EndsheetsEndsheet PicturesLeft-hand pageUpper left: Assyrian war chariots carrying religious standardsUpper right: Cyrus Cylinder, which records his capture of Babylon and his freeing of prisoners to return to their homelandsLower left: Clay tablet reporting the capture of Jerusalem by Nebuchadnezzar II; 617 B.C.E.Lower right: Ruins of gateway near the site of the audience hall of Darius I at PersepolisRight-hand pageBabylon being invaded by soldiers of Cyrus the Great in 539 B.C.E.

title: Back Endsheets
html: Back EndsheetsEndsheet PicturesLeft-hand pageTop: Ruins of ancient Corinth, with the Acrocorinthus in the backgroundCenter: Coin of Titus commemorating the capture of Jerusalem in 70 C.E.Bottom: Theater in Ephesus, with an inset showing an image of the goddess Artemis, an object of intense veneration by the EphesiansRight-hand pageThe apostle Paul preaching on the Areopagus in Athens
